marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= action by which humans take ownership of land and other possessions

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state/process by which humans experience a strong fear, usually accompanied by shaking and trembling
= process by which someone experiences extreme fear, ► which may be accompanied by visible symptoms such as trembling

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety
= person or animal belonging to the male sex

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= a male human

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= area located on both sides of spine between false ribs and hip bone; ◄ part of human body; ≈ often used to indicate the entire waist region of the body; euphemism for male genitals
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety
= process by which humans, deities, or objects take on a different nature, character, or form
= state in which humans have an unusually white complexion; ◄ often caused by strong emotions
= exclamation expressing grief and dismay
= state in which an event has a high intensity

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior

= bar or frame ◄ normally made of wood ► used to join two draft animals at the neck so that they can work together effectively in pulling a plow, threshing board, harrow, or wagon; ≈ often used in a figurative sense to denote oppression
= part of the body connecting the rump to the head; ► a ;place to wear ornaments, but also a yoke; ≈ a stiff neck is associated with insolence and pride
= material used to tie objects together or to tie animals or humans; ≈ associated with power and control over something or someone else

Node.gloss: to make (someone) a slave or servant|to make (someone) serve or work|to enslave
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone in authority causes others to assume a position of subservience and carry out specific duties, tasks, and obligations
= a person considered as not belonging to a certain group, be it religious, ethnic, or social

= action by which humans, either as individuals or as groups, assume a position of subservience towards a deity, perform the required rituals, and live in accordance with the requirements of that deity

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to fear|to be afraid|to be discouraged
Node.definition: = state in which humans or animals lack inner strength and courage

= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a person’s child or children, or the young of an animal

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= state in which people, animals or objects have been forcibly carried off; ► in the case of people, into slavery or exile

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

Node.gloss: to be confident|to be at ease|to be calm
Node.definition: = state in which humans feel confident and calm ◄ either because living under favorable circumstances or because of lack of fear when living under difficult circumstances

Node.gloss: to be at ease|to be secure
Node.definition: = state in which humans live a peaceful life and have nothing to fear

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= causative action by which humans inspire a strong fear in (other) humans or animals, ► resulting in panic
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus

= literally: finish; hence: = causative action by which humans and deities cause (other) humans and objects to completely disappear from existance

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= particle marking a proposition as contrastive, and so limiting the scope or impact of what was stated before

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

Node.gloss: to cause to happen|to bring about
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause events to take place without them having to necessarily be involved in the event itself
= literally: finish; hence: = causative action by which humans and deities cause (other) humans and objects to completely disappear from existance

= action by which humans or deities respond to negative behavior of (other) humans by administering some sort of punishment, which may range from a verbal rebuke to physical correction, ► often done with corrective intent, but sometimes also as retribution
= practices that conform to the laws of God

Node.gloss: to clear the guilty|to hold not guilty|to let one go unpunished
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities pronounce or consider a person innocent or cleared of wrongdoing and freed from punishment

Node.gloss: to clear the guilty|to hold not guilty|to let one go unpunished
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities pronounce or consider a person innocent or cleared of wrongdoing and freed from punishment

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state of being very serious; ► so that recovery is beyond expectation; said about wounds and sicknesses, used figuratively to refer to a state of hardship
= state in which an event is very serious in nature
= area of physical damage on the body; ◄ caused by an act of aggression

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

Node.gloss: to judge|to pass judgment|to vindicate|to rule
Node.definition: = action by which someone gives a verdict on a case or person in a dispute and ensures that the verdict is implemented, which, ideally, results in relief for the innocent and punishment for the guilty; this can only be done by someone in authority, such as a judge or ruler or even God himself
= a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

exact meaning unsure; possibly: = area of the body that is sore and painful either due to a bruise, or a wound, or a pus filled swelling; ≈ used in a figurative sense to refer to difficult circumstances
= process with which a disease or wound is restored to health or wellness

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= person to which one directs one's feelings of affection

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= action by which humans and deities are actively engaged in pursuing the well being of people and/or objects
literally: blow; hence: = action by which deities inflict punishment on people
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior
= pertaining to being without mercy towards humans and animals
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= state in which events happen with a large frequency
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else
= state of being very serious; ► so that recovery is beyond expectation; said about wounds and sicknesses, used figuratively to refer to a state of hardship
= state in which humans are physically wounded
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= state in which events happen with a large frequency
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten
primarily used in poetry: = person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others
= state in which people, animals or objects have been forcibly carried off; ► in the case of people, into slavery or exile
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= action by which someone takes all sorts of goods (including people and animals) by force from an enemy in war
= all sorts of goods, taken forcibly from an enemy in war
literally: to bring (upon); hence: = causative process by which deities cause certain events to happen to others
= act of restoring someone's health
= area of physical damage on the body; ◄ caused by an act of aggression

= causative action by which humans or deities help or cause (other) humans to be restored to health or physical strength after a disease or an accident; this could also refer to the wound or disease itself
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= person or animal that has been caused to leave their place or position by force
literally: to cry out; hence: = action by which humans or deities assign a name to a person, place, object, or phenomenon
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= action by which humans and deities are actively engaged in pursuing the well being of people and/or objects

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to restore the fortunes (of a nation)
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities restore the well being of an indivual or group
= causative action by which deities restore the well being of an indivual or group
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside

Node.gloss: to be merciful|to have mercy (on someone)|to have compassion (on someone)
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities feel compassion for other, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action: a person who feels compassion may forgive an offence, refrain from aggression and/or punishment, or revoke punishment
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= building or part of a building that has been fortified to provide additional security; often connected to the palace
= a standard or agreed upon location for a building
= state in which an object has been placed in a certain location with the intention that it will stay there for an extended period of time
literally: to go out; hence: = process by which an event starts taking place, originating from a certain deity, person, or place
literally: confession; hence: = action by which humans openly express recognition of what someone else has done or achieved
= action by which humans engage in activities associated with joy and contentment by leaping, dancing, celebrating, and even engaging in games
= causative action by which deities bring honor to people and areas
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= a large gathering of humans or creatures ► usually for a specific purpose
literally: to be established; hence: = process by which humans find security and stability
= action by which deities or humans inflict a penalty on other deities, humans, animals, or objects, usually as retribution for an offence
= causative action by which humans cause hardship to other humans
= person in a position of leadership, either within the community or within the army

Node.gloss: to come out of (a group)|to be one of a group
Node.definition: literally: to come out (of a group); hence: = process by which humans are a member of a certain community
= causative action by which humans cause other humans or animals to move to a location relatively close to the location in focus

Node.gloss: to approach|to come near|to draw near|to come forward
Node.definition: = action by which humans move to a location closer to a point of reference

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
literally: to pledge the heart; hence: = action by which humans agree to perform an event that is considered dangerous and perhaps foolish, as if they had to set aside their heart's desire

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

Node.gloss: to approach|to come near|to draw near|to come forward
Node.definition: = action by which humans move to a location closer to a point of reference
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= process by which a strong wind blows, ► causing danger and destruction and inspiring fear; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans and deities experience excitement ◄ caused by anger
literally: to go out; hence: = process by which an event starts taking place, originating from a certain deity, person, or place
= process by which a strong wind blows, ► causing danger and destruction and inspiring fear; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God and used as a symbol of warfare

Node.gloss: to sojourn|to live as alien|to dwell
Node.definition: = state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
= process by which a column of air moves rapidly round and round in a cylindrical or funnel shape

Node.gloss: to turn away|to come to an end|to cease|to subside
Node.definition: literally: (an event) turns away (from someone); hence: = process by which a certain condition comes to an end
literally: kindling of anger; hence: = process by which the anger (אַף) of deities is aroused ◄ like a fire that is kindled
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= plan or strategy thought out by humans or deities to accomplish a certain goal; ≈ when used for humans, only used in a negative sense
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= pertaining to being the last part of an event, close to its moment of completion
literally: end of days; hence: = a period of time in the future

Node.gloss: to look closely|to take note|to pay attention|to consider|to understand|to draw understanding
Node.definition: = action by which someone observes something carefully, with the intention of seeing through the outward appearance of things and grasping their essence, and so gain knowledge and understanding
